verses.verse: Be <S%H408>not<s%> thou <S%H7065>envious<s%> against <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H376>men,<s%> <S%H408>neither<s%> <S%H183>desire<s%> to <S%H1961>be<s%> <S%H854>with<s%> them.
For <S%H3588><s%> their <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H1897>studieth<s%> <S%H7701>destruction,<s%> and their <S%H8193>lips<s%> <S%H1696>talk<s%> of <S%H5999>mischief.<s%>
Through <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> is a <S%H1004>house<s%> <S%H1129>built;<s%> and by <S%H8394>understanding<s%> it is established: <S%H3559><s%>
And by <S%H1847>knowledge<s%> shall the <S%H2315>chambers<s%> be <S%H4390>filled<s%> with <S%H3605>all<s%> <S%H3368>precious<s%> and <S%H5273>pleasant<s%> <S%H1952>riches.<s%>
A <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H1397>man<s%> is <S%H5797>strong;<s%> yea, a <S%H376>man<s%> of <S%H1847>knowledge<s%> <S%H553>increaseth<s%> <S%H3581>strength.<s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> by wise <S%H8458>counsel<s%> thou shalt <S%H6213>make<s%> thy <S%H4421>war:<s%> and in <S%H7230>multitude<s%> of <S%H3289>counselors<s%> there is <S%H8668>safety.<s%>
Wisdom <S%H2454><s%> is too <S%H7311>high<s%> for a <S%H191>fool:<s%> he <S%H6605>openeth<s%> <S%H3808>not<s%> his <S%H6310>mouth<s%> in the <S%H8179>gate.<s%>
He that <S%H2803>deviseth<s%> to do <S%H7489>evil<s%> shall be <S%H7121>called<s%> a <S%H4209>mischievous<s%> <S%H1167>person.<s%>
The <S%H2154>thought<s%> of <S%H200>foolishness<s%> is <S%H2403>sin:<s%> and the <S%H3887>scorner<s%> is an <S%H8441>abomination<s%> to <S%H120>men.<s%>
If thou <S%H7503>faint<s%> in the <S%H3117>day<s%> of <S%H6869>adversity,<s%> thy <S%H3581>strength<s%> is <S%H6862>small.<s%>
If <S%H518><s%> thou <S%H2820>forbear<s%> to <S%H5337>deliver<s%> them that are <S%H3947>drawn<s%> unto <S%H4194>death,<s%> and those that are <S%H4131>ready<s%> to be <S%H2027>slain;<s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> thou <S%H559>sayest,<s%> <S%H2005>Behold,<s%> we <S%H3045>knew<s%> <S%H2088>it<s%> <S%H3808>not;<s%> doth <S%H3808>not<s%> he that <S%H8505>pondereth<s%> the <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H995>consider<s%> it? and he that <S%H5341>keepeth<s%> thy <S%H5315>soul,<s%> doth not <S%H1931>he<s%> <S%H3045>know<s%> it? and shall not he <S%H7725>render<s%> to every <S%H120>man<s%> according to his <S%H6467>works?<s%>

My <S%H1121>son,<s%> <S%H398>eat<s%> thou <S%H1706>honey,<s%> <S%H3588>because<s%> it is <S%H2896>good;<s%> and the <S%H5317>honeycomb,<s%> which is <S%H4966>sweet<s%> <S%H5921>to<s%> thy taste: <S%H2441><s%>

So <S%H3651><s%> shall the <S%H3045>knowledge<s%> of <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> be unto thy <S%H5315>soul:<s%> <S%H518>when<s%> thou hast <S%H4672>found<s%> it, then there shall <S%H3426>be<s%> a <S%H319>reward,<s%> and thy <S%H8615>expectation<s%> shall <S%H3808>not<s%> be cut <S%H3772>off.<s%>
Lay not <S%H408>wait,<s%> <S%H693><s%> O <S%H7563>wicked<s%> man, against the <S%H5116>dwelling<s%> of the <S%H6662>righteous;<s%> <S%H7703>spoil<s%> <S%H408>not<s%> his resting place: <S%H7258><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> a <S%H6662>just<s%> man <S%H5307>falleth<s%> <S%H7651>seven<s%> times, and riseth up <S%H6965>again:<s%> but the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> shall <S%H3782>fall<s%> into <S%H7451>mischief.<s%>
Rejoice <S%H8055><s%> <S%H408>not<s%> when thine <S%H341>enemy<s%> <S%H5307>falleth,<s%> and let <S%H408>not<s%> thine <S%H3820>heart<s%> be <S%H1523>glad<s%> when he stumbleth: <S%H3782><s%>
Lest <S%H6435><s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H7200>see<s%> it, and it <S%H7489>displease<s%> <S%H5869><s%> him, and he turn <S%H7725>away<s%> his <S%H639>wrath<s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> <S%H5921><s%> him.
Fret not <S%H408>thyself<s%> <S%H2734><s%> because of <S%H7489>evil<s%> men, <S%H408>neither<s%> be thou <S%H7065>envious<s%> at the <S%H7563>wicked;<s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> there shall <S%H1961>be<s%> <S%H3808>no<s%> <S%H319>reward<s%> to the <S%H7451>evil<s%> man; the <S%H5216>candle<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> shall be put <S%H1846>out.<s%>

My <S%H1121>son,<s%> <S%H3372>fear<s%> <S%H853>thou<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> and the <S%H4428>king:<s%> and <S%H6148>meddle<s%> <S%H408>not<s%> <S%H5973>with<s%> them that are given to change: <S%H8138><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> their <S%H343>calamity<s%> shall <S%H6965>rise<s%> <S%H6597>suddenly;<s%> and <S%H4310>who<s%> <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> the <S%H6365>ruin<s%> of them <S%H8147>both?<s%>
These <S%H428><s%> things <S%H1571>also<s%> belong to the <S%H2450>wise.<s%> It is <S%H1077>not<s%> <S%H2896>good<s%> to have <S%H5234>respect<s%> of <S%H6440>persons<s%> in <S%H4941>judgment.<s%>

He that <S%H559>saith<s%> unto the <S%H7563>wicked,<s%> <S%H859>Thou<s%> art <S%H6662>righteous;<s%> him shall the <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H5344>curse,<s%> <S%H3816>nations<s%> shall <S%H2194>abhor<s%> him:
But to them that <S%H3198>rebuke<s%> him shall be <S%H5276>delight,<s%> and a <S%H2896>good<s%> <S%H1293>blessing<s%> shall <S%H935>come<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> them.
Every man shall <S%H5401>kiss<s%> his <S%H8193>lips<s%> that <S%H7725>giveth<s%> a <S%H5228>right<s%> <S%H1697>answer.<s%>

Prepare <S%H3559><s%> thy <S%H4399>work<s%> <S%H2351>without,<s%> and make it <S%H6257>fit<s%> for thyself in the <S%H7704>field;<s%> and <S%H310>afterwards<s%> <S%H1129>build<s%> thine <S%H1004>house.<s%>
Be <S%H1961><s%> <S%H408>not<s%> a <S%H5707>witness<s%> against thy <S%H7453>neighbor<s%> without <S%H2600>cause;<s%> and <S%H6601>deceive<s%> not with thy <S%H8193>lips.<s%>

Say <S%H559><s%> <S%H408>not,<s%> I will <S%H6213>do<s%> <S%H3651>so<s%> to him <S%H834>as<s%> he hath <S%H6213>done<s%> to me: I will <S%H7725>render<s%> to the <S%H376>man<s%> according to his <S%H6467>work.<s%>

I <S%H5674>went<s%> <S%H5921>by<s%> the <S%H7704>field<s%> of the <S%H6102>slothful,<s%> <S%H376><s%> and <S%H5921>by<s%> the <S%H3754>vineyard<s%> of the <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H2638>void<s%> of <S%H3820>understanding;<s%>

And, <S%H2009>lo,<s%> it was <S%H3605>all<s%> grown <S%H5927>over<s%> with <S%H7063>thorns,<s%> and <S%H2738>nettles<s%> had <S%H3680>covered<s%> the <S%H6440>face<s%> thereof, and the <S%H68>stone<s%> <S%H1444>wall<s%> thereof was broken <S%H2040>down.<s%>
Then <S%H595>I<s%> <S%H2372>saw,<s%> and considered it <S%H7896>well:<s%> <S%H3820><s%> I <S%H7200>looked<s%> upon it, and <S%H3947>received<s%> <S%H4148>instruction.<s%>
Yet a <S%H4592>little<s%> <S%H8142>sleep,<s%> a <S%H4592>little<s%> <S%H8572>slumber,<s%> a <S%H4592>little<s%> <S%H2264>folding<s%> of the <S%H3027>hands<s%> to sleep: <S%H7901><s%>
So shall thy <S%H7389>poverty<s%> <S%H935>come<s%> as one that <S%H1980>traveleth;<s%> and thy <S%H4270>want<s%> as an <S%H4043>armed<s%> <S%H376>man.<s%>
